resources.string: The App Icon. A paper with text on it with a open lock in front of it.
Easily access articles and papers licensed by your library.

How to use this app
 Many academic libraries provide a so-called proxy prefix which can be added to a link to an article you want to read and - if your library has licensed the content - allows you to login via your library and access it. Check if your library offers something called EZProxy or a proxy prefix.

 After setting your librarys proxy url you can pass links to scientific articles behind paywalls to this app in three ways:

 Use the system share function to send it to Link2Lib, click the clipboard button in the corner to paste a link from your clipboard or configure certain publishers domains to be automatically opened using this app when clicked.
Set Proxy\n Select or add your library\'s proxy url
\"Open by Default\" Settings\n Select publisher domains for auto-detection
History\n Look at your previously accessed urls
